width=”1/3″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

X

November 17 (Thursday)
08:30 AM

11:45 PM

 Liver Transplant Pathology HALL D
Moderators Khaled Zalata, MD, PhD (Mansoura University, Egypt)
Target audience Pathologists and those in Liver Pathology raining. Also, other members of Liver transplantation teams including hepatologists, surgeons and radiologists could have good benefit to be familiar with Liver transplantation pathology and to gain the common language with the pathologists.

The aim of the Liver transplantation Pathology Workshop is to provide a good idea about the principles and interpretation of liver biopsy specimens in this field.
Objectives
  • Indications of liver biopsy in liver transplantation
  • Dealing with potential donor liver biopsy specimens.
  • The role of liver biopsy in early post-transplant period.
  • Different patterns and features of acute and chronic rejection.
  • Understand more the role of protocol biopsies
  • The possible role of non-invasive tools to predict and diagnose the post-transplantation problems.
Additional Instructions Please contact the organizer for registration.
08:30 AM

10:15 AM

 Session 1
Chairpersons  Anthony J. Demetris, MD (University of Pittsburgh, USA)

 Magda El Monayeri, MD, PhD (Ain Shams University, Egypt)

 Khaled Zalata, MD, PhD (Mansoura University, Egypt)
08:30 AM

08:50 AM

 Donor selection with Macrovesicular Steatosis/ MAFLD in LDLT 

Wagdi El Kashef, MD (Mansoura University, Egypt)
08:50 AM

09:10 AM

 Controversy in early Post-liver transplant cholestasis, Liver Biopsy

Khaled Zalata, MD, PhD (Mansoura University, Egypt)

09:10 AM

09:30 AM

 Protocol biopsy post-Liver Tx, where we stand?

Anthony J. Demetris, MD (University of Pittsburgh, USA)
09:30 AM

09:50 AM

 Slide presentation     

Mansoura University, pathology team
09:50 AM

10:00 AM

 Questions                        

 
10:00 AM

10:15 AM

 Break
10:15 AM

11:45 AM

 Session 2
Chairpersons  Anthony J. Demetris, MD (University of Pittsburgh, USA)

 Josh Levitsky (Northwestern University, USA)

 Nedal Hegazy (Ain Shams university, Egypt)

 Nermine Ehsan (Menoufia University, Egypt)
10:15 AM

10:35 AM

 T cell-mediated rejection; early and late; Histopathological features and variants.

Magda El Monayeri, MD, PhD (Ain Shams University, Egypt)
10:35 AM

10:55 AM

 Chronic rejection, after Liver Tx. Role of liver biopsy and its evolving histopathological appearance

Rehab Talat, MD (Mansoura University, Egypt)
10:55 AM

11:15 AM

 Molecular markers in liver graft dysfunction, is it possible to limit the need for Liver biopsy?

Nehal Radwan, MD (Ain Shams University, Egypt)

11:15 AM

11:35 AM

 Slide presentation     

Ain Sham University, pathology team
11:35 AM

11:45 AM

 Questions
